SEARCH
Module org.klojang.templates
Package org.klojang.templates

Interface Accessor<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the source data object
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface Accessor<T>
Defines a very general contract for name-based extraction of values from objects. The extraction takes places based on the name of template variable. Just as Template and SoloSession are the two central classes of Klojang Templates, so are Accessor and Stringifier the two central interfaces of Klojang Templates. See AccessorRegistry for more information.
Author:
Ayco Holleman

  • Field Details

    • UNDEFINED

      static final Object UNDEFINED
      The value that should be returned by the access() method if a template variable cannot be mapped to an identifier in the source data. For example, if the template is populated from a HashMap, then the template variable must correspond to a map key (possibly indirectly, via a NameMapper). If the HashMap does not contain that key, the access() must return UNDEFINED. Accessor implementations should not throw an exception and they should not return null. null is a legitimate, "insertable" value (usually converted to an empty string). If an Accessor returns UNDEFINED for a particular template variable, the SoloSession will skip setting that variable. This allows you to insert another source data object into the template that does have a value for the variable. (Note that once a template variable has been set, it cannot be set again within the same RenderSession.)

  • Method Details

    • access

      Object access(T data, String property) throws RenderException
      Returns the value of the specified property within the specified model object. The term "property" is somewhat misleading here, because the data argument can be anything a specific Accessor implementation decides to take care of. It could, for example, also be a Map and property would then (most likely) specify a map key.
      Parameters:
      data - the data to be accessed
      property - the name by which to retrieve the desired value from the data
      Returns:
      the value
      Throws:
      RenderException - if an error occurs while extracting the value
